description:
Error is below

Perhaps worth making the MySQL tests optional until we get MySQL-python fixed upstream

  Running setup.py install for MySQL-python

    Running command /home/markmc/git/openstack/nova/.venv/bin/python -c "import setuptools;__file__='/home/markmc/git/openstack/nova/.venv/build/MySQL-python/setup.py';exec(compile(open(__file__).read().replace('\r\n', '\n'), __file__, 'exec'))" install --single-version-externally-managed --record /tmp/pip-4DBiCk-record/install-record.txt --install-headers /home/markmc/git/openstack/nova/.venv/include/site/python2.7

title: venv creation fails on Fedora 16 because of MySQL-python issue

comments.content:
Error is below

Perhaps worth making the MySQL tests optional until we get MySQL-python fixed upstream

comments.content:
WFM with mysql-devel RPM installed.

I only got this compile warning:

    In file included from /usr/include/mysql/my_config.h:14:0,
                     from _mysql.c:36:
    /usr/include/mysql/my_config_x86_64.h:422:0: warning: "HAVE_WCSCOLL" redefined [enabled by default]
    /usr/include/python2.7/pyconfig-64.h:893:0: note: this is the location of the previous definition
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~apevec

comments.content: Thanks for that Alan, I was just being dump. Works with mysql-devel installed
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~markmc
